Component-wise standard errors of Theta

Source: R/PLNfit-S3methods.R
standard_error.Rd

Extracts univariate standard errors for the estimated coefficient of Theta. Standard errors are computed from the (approximate) Fisher information matrix.

standard_error(object)

# S3 method for PLNfit
standard_error(object)

Arguments

object

an R6 object with class PLNfit

Value

A p * d positive matrix (same size as \(\Theta\)) with standard errors for the coefficients of \(\Theta\)

Methods (by class)

  • standard_error(PLNfit): Component-wise standard errors of Theta in PLNfit

See also

vcov.PLNfit() for the complete variance covariance estimation of the coefficient

Examples

data(trichoptera)
trichoptera <- prepare_data(trichoptera$Abundance, trichoptera$Covariate)
myPLN <- PLN(Abundance ~ 1 + offset(log(Offset)), data = trichoptera)
#> 
#>  Initialization...
#>  Adjusting a PLN model with full covariance model
#>  Post-treatments...
#>  DONE!
standard_error(myPLN)
#>     (Intercept)
#> Che  4.04194509
#> Hyc  4.04090164
#> Hym  0.51745262
#> Hys  2.85763334
#> Psy  0.09046421
#> Aga  0.67056684
#> Glo  1.87070230
#> Ath  1.87087324
#> Cea  2.64621357
#> Ced  0.64991141
#> Set  0.50916859
#> All  0.97086434
#> Han  0.50622572
#> Hfo  0.60667258
#> Hsp  0.32285124
#> Hve  2.33342970
#> Sta  0.41034307
